TopicTitle: "Abort to Launch" and "Abort to VAB" options

Articles.Content:
Quite often, my launches in career mode will fail. I don't think I'm alone in this!

Now, if I was playing the game properly, I would watch the out-of-charge probe spiral into a hillside, taking my funds with it. Or watch the orbital insertion stage gracefully arc into the sea, solar panels still safely packed away.

However, I am too lazy to do this, and so I cheat, and revert the flight.

It would be cool if there was an option to "abort" to the VAB or the launch pad, so you still lose the craft and your funds, but you can get straight back into your launch (with a copy, naturally), or make some tweaks without having to watch the inevitable crash, and then sit through some extra loading screens.

Edited July 19, 2014 by peadar1987

Yeah, I think it makes it more attractive an option to revert flight when it's easier to revert back to VAB. Revert should take you to space center before the launch, and Abort should bring you to Space Center, or VAB.
